senses.sense_definition: To rise above or be taller than something else.

examples.text: The ancient pine tree <w>overtopped</w> the surrounding forest, serving as a landmark for miles.
During the hurricane, the massive waves began to <w>overtop</w> the sea wall.

senses.sense_definition: To put an excessive amount of toppings on food.

examples.text: If you <w>overtop</w> the pizza, the crust will not cook evenly.
Amateur bakers often <w>overtop</w> their cupcakes with too much frosting.

senses.sense_definition: A piece of clothing worn over the upper part of an outfit, such as a vest, tunic, or outer shirt.

examples.text: She wore a sheer <w>overtop</w> to add a layer of elegance to her evening dress.
This knitted <w>overtop</w> is perfect for keeping warm on chilly autumn days.

senses.sense_definition: In a position covering or located above something.

examples.text: He filled the hole with soil and scattered dry leaves <w>overtop</w> to conceal it.
Place the grilled vegetables on the plate and drizzle the sauce <w>overtop</w>.
